description: Automation domain exposes commands for automating user interactions with the browser.

types.description: The coordinate system in which rects, points, and sizes are to be interpreted.
An opaque identifier for a browsing context.
How a browsing context is presented by the user agent. A browsing context is considered a tab if it shares an OS-level window with another browsing context.
An opaque identifier for a frame in a page.
An opaque identifier for a node in a page.

This enum contains predefined error messages that can be used to signal a well-defined error condition, such as a missing implementation, unknown window handle, and so forth. The backend signals one of these errors by using it as a prefix of the commands's error message (the errorString argument in generated C++ backend dispatchers). This will be reported to the frontend as a protocol error with a JSON-RPC error code of 'ServerError'. It is up to the frontend whether and how to deal with errors.
A handle representing an open window or tab in the automation session.

properties.name: handle
properties.description: Opaque handle for a browsing context (window or tab). Used as a key for window-related commands.

properties.name: active
properties.description: Whether the browsing context has focus at the time the command is handled.

properties.name: url
properties.description: The URL loaded by the browsing context at the time the command is handled.

properties.name: windowSize
properties.description: The current size of the browsing context's window.

properties.name: windowOrigin
properties.description: The current (x, y) position of the browsing context's window relative to the top-left of the screen.

types.description: Enumerates different ways of interacting with a mouse cursor.
Enumerates different mouse buttons that can be used.
Enumerates different key modifiers that can remain pressed during other mouse/touch interactions.
Enumerates different platform-independent virtual keys on a physical keyboard whose input via keyboard may or may not produce characters.

Enumerates different ways of interacting with a keyboard device. 'InsertByKey' implies that a separate KeyDown and KeyUp event are produced for each combining character sequence, regardless of the actual keystrokes required to produce the character sequence.

A single step in a key sequence. A step can contain a key up/down of a virtual key, or a sequence of Unicode code points that are delivered to the page at grapheme cluster boundaries. Either a 'key' or 'text' property must be specified.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of interaction to be performed by a step.

properties.name: key
properties.description: A virtual key to be used to perform the specified interaction.

properties.name: text
properties.description: A unicode string to be delivered to the page. The sequence of key events is determined by splitting the string at grapheme cluster boundaries.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Cookie name.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Cookie value.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: Cookie domain. If empty, the domain is inherited from the relevant browsing context.

properties.name: path
properties.description: Cookie path.

properties.name: expires
properties.description: Cookie expiration in seconds since the UNIX epoch.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Cookie size.

properties.name: httpOnly
properties.description: True if cookie is http-only.

properties.name: secure
properties.description: True if cookie is secure.

properties.name: session
properties.description: True in case of session cookie.

types.description: Enumerates different permissions that must be obtained in order to use privileged APIs.

The type of an input source. This determines which state properties are applicable to the input source. The 'Null' input source type has no properties, only a duration. This can extend the effective wait for a tick.

properties.name: sourceId
properties.description: A unique identifier for this input source.

properties.name: sourceType
properties.description: The type of this input source. This affects what input source state fields are valid for this input source.

types.description: A set of input source states to which all applicable input sources must transition before further steps may be processed. If an input source does not have a corresponding state in a step, its state assumed to be 'released' for that step.

properties.name: states
properties.description: A list of new input states for input sources that must transition during this step. Source state transitions that cannot be performed concurrently (i.e., touch gestures) are performed sequentially in the order they are listed.

types.description: Enumerates different origin types that can be used in mouse move interactions.

A new state for a specific input source. All state-related fields are optional and must be applicable to the InputSource referenced by 'sourceId'. If no state-related fields are specified, the state is assumed to remain the same as in the previous step (i.e., 'sustained').

properties.name: sourceId
properties.description: The input source whose state is described by this object.

properties.name: pressedCharKey
properties.description: For 'keyboard' input sources, specifies a character key that has 'pressed' state. Unmentioned character keys are assumed to have a 'released' state.

properties.name: pressedVirtualKeys
properties.description: For 'keyboard' input sources, specifies virtual keys that have a 'pressed' state. Unmentioned virtual keys are assumed to have a 'released' state.

properties.name: pressedButton
properties.description: For 'mouse' input sources, specifies which mouse button has a 'pressed' state. Unmentioned mouse buttons are assumed to have a 'released' state.

properties.name: origin
properties.description: For 'mouse' input sources, specifies the origin type of a mouse move transition. Defaults to 'Viewport' if omitted.

properties.name: nodeHandle
properties.description: The handle of the element to use as origin when origin type is 'Element'.

properties.name: location
properties.description: For 'mouse' or 'touch' input sources, specifies a location in view coordinates to which the input source should transition. Transitioning to this state may interpolate intemediate input source states to better simulate real user movements and gestures.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: The minimum number of milliseconds that must elapse while the relevant input source transitions to this state.

commands.name: getBrowsingContexts
commands.description: Fetches information about all open browsing contexts (windows and tabs) in the automation session.

returns.name: contexts
returns.description: All known browsing contexts available to the session.

commands.name: getBrowsingContext
commands.description: Fetches information about the specified browsing context.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

returns.name: context
returns.description: The browsing context available to the session.

commands.name: createBrowsingContext
commands.description: Opens a new browsing context in the automation session and makes it the active browsing context for user interaction. This command creates a browsing context in a new window rather than adding a tab to an existing window.

parameters.name: presentationHint
parameters.description: A hint for the desired presentation of new browsing context (new tab or new window).

returns.name: handle
returns.description: An opaque handle for the newly created browsing context.

returns.name: presentation
returns.description: How the browser presented the new browsing context (new tab or new window).

commands.name: closeBrowsingContext
commands.description: Try to close the specified browsing context. This can trigger an unload prompt and thereafter succeed or fail.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be closed.

commands.name: switchToBrowsingContext
commands.description: Activates the specified browsing context and optional frame, which gives them focus (causing the 'focus' DOM event to fire, and 'blur' DOM event to fire for the previous browsing context and frame).

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be made focused.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame that should be focused. Defaults to the main frame if omitted.

commands.name: setWindowFrameOfBrowsingContext
commands.description: Moves and/or resizes the window of the specified top-level browsing context to the specified position and size. Both position and size may be omitted. This command implicitly exits fullscreen and restores the window (if previously hidden), then optionally sets the window frame.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context to be resized.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: The new origin for the browsing context's window. The position is interpreted in screen coordinate space, relative to the upper left corner of the screen.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The new size for the browsing context's window. The size is interpreted in screen pixels.

commands.name: maximizeWindowOfBrowsingContext
commands.description: Causes the window of the specified browsing context to be maximized. This command implicitly exits fullscreen mode.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context whose window should be maximized.

commands.name: hideWindowOfBrowsingContext
commands.description: Causes the window of the specified browsing context to be hidden/minimized/iconified. This command implicitly exits fullscreen mode.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context whose window should be hidden.

commands.name: navigateBrowsingContext
commands.description: Navigates a browsing context to a specified URL.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be navigated.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL to load in the browsing context.

parameters.name: pageLoadStrategy
parameters.description: The page load strategy to use when determining when navigation is complete.

parameters.name: pageLoadTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds that the navigation is expected to be completed in, otherwise a Timeout error is returned.

commands.name: goBackInBrowsingContext
commands.description: Navigates a browsing context to go back one page in history.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be navigated.

parameters.name: pageLoadStrategy
parameters.description: The page load strategy to use when determining when navigation is complete.

parameters.name: pageLoadTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds that the navigation is expected to be completed in, otherwise a Timeout error is returned.

commands.name: goForwardInBrowsingContext
commands.description: Navigates a browsing context to got forward one page in history.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be navigated.

parameters.name: pageLoadStrategy
parameters.description: The page load strategy to use when determining when navigation is complete.

parameters.name: pageLoadTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds that the navigation is expected to be completed in, otherwise a Timeout error is returned.

commands.name: reloadBrowsingContext
commands.description: Reloads the current page in a browsing context.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be reloaded.

parameters.name: pageLoadStrategy
parameters.description: The page load strategy to use when determining when navigation is complete.

parameters.name: pageLoadTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds that the navigation is expected to be completed in, otherwise a Timeout error is returned.

commands.name: waitForNavigationToComplete
commands.description: Wait for pending navigation to complete.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context in which wait for pending navigation to complete.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame in which wait for pending navigation to complete. The main frame is used if this parameter empty string or excluded.

parameters.name: pageLoadStrategy
parameters.description: The page load strategy to use when determining when navigation is complete.

parameters.name: pageLoadTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds that the navigation is expected to be completed in, otherwise a Timeout error is returned.

commands.name: inspectBrowsingContext
commands.description: Inspect the specified browsing context using Web Inspector.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context that should be inspected.

parameters.name: enableAutoCapturing
parameters.description: If this option is present and set to true, the Web Inspector will automatically start a timeline recording of the specified browsing context once it is attached. Note that this disables the debugger for the duration of the recording.

commands.name: evaluateJavaScriptFunction
commands.description: Evaluates a script function in a browsing context and calls it with the supplied arguments.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context the script should be evaluated.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame the script should be evaluated. The main frame is used if this parameter empty string or excluded.

parameters.name: function
parameters.description: The script to evaluate in the browsing context. It must be a function result.

parameters.name: arguments
parameters.description: The arguments to pass to the function when called. They will be parsed as JSON before calling the function.

parameters.name: expectsImplicitCallbackArgument
parameters.description: The function expects a callback function as the last argument. It is expected to call this callback with a result.

parameters.name: callbackTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout in milliseconds that the implicit callback is expected to be called in, otherwise a JavaScriptTimeout error is returned.

returns.name: result
returns.description: The result returned by the called function. It is JSON encoded after the function returns or calls the callback.

commands.name: performMouseInteraction
commands.description: Simulates interaction with a mouse cursor.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The browsing context to be interacted with.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The requested position for the mouse cursor, specified in viewport coordinates.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: The button to use to perform the interaction. This parameter only has an effect for the Down, Up, Click, and DoubleClick mouse interactions.

parameters.name: interaction
parameters.description: The type of interaction to be performed with the mouse cursor.

parameters.name: modifiers
parameters.description: Key modifiers to be active during the mouse interaction.

returns.name: position
returns.description: The updated position of the mouse cursor, specified in viewport coordinates.

commands.name: performKeyboardInteractions
commands.description: Simulates delivering the results of pressing one or more keyboard keys together or successively.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context which should receive key.

parameters.name: interactions
parameters.description: An ordered list of key sequences to be delivered using native key events.

commands.name: performInteractionSequence
commands.description: Perform multiple simulated interactions over time using a list of input sources and a list of steps, where each step specifies a state for each input source at the time that step is performed.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The browsing context to be interacted with.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame in which to search for the elements in case of an 'Element' type MouseMoveOrigin. The main frame is used if this parameter empty string or excluded.

parameters.name: inputSources
parameters.description: All input sources that are used to perform this interaction sequence.

parameters.name: steps
parameters.description: A list of steps that are executed in order.

commands.name: cancelInteractionSequence
commands.description: Cancel an active interaction sequence that is currently in progress.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The browsing context to be interacted with.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame passed to performInteractionSequence. The main frame is used if this parameter empty string or excluded.

commands.name: takeScreenshot
commands.description: Take a screenshot of the current page or given element in a browsing context.

parameters.name: handle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context to take a screenshot of.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame that contains the element. The main frame is used if this parameter is empty string or excluded.

parameters.name: nodeHandle
parameters.description: The handle of the element to take a screenshot of. The browsing context document element is used if this parameter is excluded.

parameters.name: scrollIntoViewIfNeeded
parameters.description: If the element should be scrolled into view before taking the screenshot.

parameters.name: clipToViewport
parameters.description: Whether a screenshot of the entire page should be clipped to the visual viewport. A value of 'false' preserves behavior for legacy protocol screenshots.

commands.name: resolveChildFrameHandle
commands.description: Determines the FrameHandle based on the ordinal, name or node handle of a child frame.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context in which to search for the frame.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame in which to search for the frame. The main frame is used if this parameter empty string or excluded.

parameters.name: ordinal
parameters.description: The ordinal of the child frame to resolve as a FrameHandle. This is analogous to 'window.frames[ordinal]' in JavaScript.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the child frame to resolve as a FrameHandle. This is analogous to 'window.frames[name]' in JavaScript.

parameters.name: nodeHandle
parameters.description: The handle of the child frame owner element to resolve as a FrameHandle.

commands.name: resolveParentFrameHandle
commands.description: Determines the FrameHandle for the parent frame of the supplied FrameHandle.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context the frame is located.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame that should resolve its parent frame.

commands.name: computeElementLayout
commands.description: Computes the layout for an element.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context the frame is located.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame that contains the element.

parameters.name: nodeHandle
parameters.description: The handle of the element to use.

parameters.name: scrollIntoViewIfNeeded
parameters.description: If the element should be scrolled into view before computing its layout.

parameters.name: coordinateSystem
parameters.description: The coordinate system to use for rect and point results.

returns.name: rect
returns.description: The layout rect for the requested element. Values are converted to the requested coordinate system.

returns.name: inViewCenterPoint
returns.description: The in-view center point for the requested element. Values are converted to the requested coordinate system.

returns.name: isObscured
returns.description: If the in-view center point of the requested element is obscured by another element.

commands.name: selectOptionElement
commands.description: Selects the given option element. In case of container with multiple options enabled, the element selectedness is toggled.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

parameters.name: frameHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the frame that contains the element.

parameters.name: nodeHandle
parameters.description: The handle of the element to use.

commands.name: isShowingJavaScriptDialog
commands.description: Checks if a browsing context is showing a JavaScript alert, confirm, or prompt dialog.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

returns.name: result
returns.description: If the browsing context is showing a JavaScript dialog or not.

commands.name: dismissCurrentJavaScriptDialog
commands.description: Dismisses a JavaScript alert, confirm, or prompt dialog currently showing in a browsing context. Equivalent to clicking the 'Cancel' button.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

commands.name: acceptCurrentJavaScriptDialog
commands.description: Accepts a JavaScript alert, confirm, or prompt dialog currently showing in a browsing context. Equivalent to clicking the 'OK' button.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

commands.name: messageOfCurrentJavaScriptDialog
commands.description: Returns the text displayed in a JavaScript alert, confirm, or prompt dialog currently showing in a browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

returns.name: message
returns.description: Text being displayed in the current JavaScript dialog.

commands.name: setUserInputForCurrentJavaScriptPrompt
commands.description: Sets the user entered value in a JavaScript prompt dialog currently showing in a browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

parameters.name: userInput
parameters.description: The text to enter in the prompt.

commands.name: setFilesToSelectForFileUpload
commands.description: Sets the files to be selected when a file input type element becomes active in a browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

parameters.name: filenames
parameters.description: Absolute paths to the files that should be selected.

commands.name: getAllCookies
commands.description: Returns all cookies visible to the specified browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

commands.name: deleteSingleCookie
commands.description: Deletes a cookie with the given name if visible to the specified browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

parameters.name: cookieName
parameters.description: Name of the cookie to remove.

commands.name: addSingleCookie
commands.description: Add a cookie to cookie storage for the specified browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: The cookie that should be added to storage.

commands.name: deleteAllCookies
commands.description: Delete all cookies that are visible to the specified browsing context.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

commands.name: getSessionPermissions
commands.description: Returns the state of all session permissions, which control whether privileged Web APIs can be used. Permissions are applied to all browsing contexts associated with the automation session.

returns.name: permissions
returns.description: Array of available session permissions and their values.

commands.name: setSessionPermissions
commands.description: Attempts to set the state of session permissions, which control whether privileged Web APIs can be used. Permissions that are not understood are ignored. Permissions are applied to all browsing contexts associated with the automation session.

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.description: Array of session permissions to set, if they are available.

events.name: fileChooserDismissed
events.description: Fired when a file chooser for a file input element is dismissed by selecting files or cancelling.

parameters.name: browsingContextHandle
parameters.description: The handle for the browsing context.

parameters.name: selectionCancelled
parameters.description: If true, the chooser was dismissed because file selection was cancelled.

events.name: browsingContextCleared
events.description: Fired when the specified browsing context has navigated or closed. Existing element references from the browsing context are no longer valid.
